document.docAuthor: Duan, Yanhao & Zhang, Tao & Shi, Fuming
document.docTitle: Notes on the genus Homogryllacris Liu, 2007 (Orthoptera: Gryllacrididae) with description of one new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes on the genus Homogryllacris Liu, 2007 (Orthoptera: Gryllacrididae) with description of one new species from China

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Key Laboratory of Zoological Systematics and Application of Hebei Province, College of Life Science, Hebei University, 071002, Baoding, P. R. China
Key Laboratory of Zoological Systematics and Application of Hebei Province, College of Life Science, Hebei University, 071002, Baoding, P. R. China

emphasis.docTitle:
Notes on the genus
Homogryllacris Liu, 2007
( Orthoptera : Gryllacrididae ) with description of one new species from China

subSection.paragraph: YANHAO DUAN 1, 2 , TAO ZHANG 3 & FUMING SHI 1*

emphasis.docAuthorAffiliation: Key Laboratory of Zoological Systematics and Application of Hebei Province , College of Life Science, Hebei University, 071002, Baoding, P. R. China

subSection.paragraph:
This paper deals with five species of the genus
Homogryllacris Liu, 2007
from China , including one new species, i.e.
Homogryllacris nigromacula
sp. nov.
Morphological illustrations of most species and habitus of the new species are provided. Moreover, one geographical population of
Homogryllacris yunnana Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
and intraspecific variation of
Homogryllacris platycis Liu & Bian, 2021
are discussed and illustrated. All specimens examined are deposited in the Museum of Hebei University.

Key words:
Gryllacrididae
,
Homogryllacris
,
new species
,
China

We examined the
Homogryllacris
specimens collected from south China in recent years. Intraspecific variation of
Homogryllacris yunnana Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
and
Homogryllacris platycis Liu & Bian, 2021
are discussed. Furthermore, on the base of new material collected from Xizang in September 2023 , we describe one new species of the genus:
Homogryllacris nigromacula
sp. nov.
All specimens examined are deposited in the Museum of Hebei University, Baoding, China .

Morphological images were acquired using Leica M205A digital imaging system.Image editing was accomplished using Adobe Photoshop CC 2019. The following conventions were adopted for the specimen measurements: body length—distance from apex of fastigium verticis to posterior margin of ninth abdominal tergite in the midline; pronotum length—distance from anterior to posterior margins of pronotum in the midline; tegmen length—distance of visible part from base of tegmen to the apex; hind femur length—distance from base of hind femur to apex of genicular lobe; ovipositor length—distance from base of subgenital plate to apex of ovipositor.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Homogryllacris curvicauda Du, Bian & Shi, 2016
, Zootaxa , 4111 (2): 191.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Holotype : male; type locality: Tianhuangmiao , Tianlin , Guangxi .
1♂ , Huangjing, Gulin, Sichuan , 5 August, 2020, coll. Jie Su.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. China ( Sichuan , Guangxi ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Homogryllacris curvicauda Du, Bian & Shi, 2016
, male: A . face; B–C . head and pronotum: B . lateral view; C . dorsal view; D–F , H . apex of abdomen: D , F . lateral view; E . dorsal view; H . apical view; G . stridulatory pegs on second and third abdominal tergites; I . subgenital plate.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Homogryllacris yunnana
Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
, Zootaxa , 3414: 64. Holotype : male; type locality: Caiyanghe , Pu’er , Yunnan .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Homogryllacris yunnana Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
(specimens from Meizihu, Pu’er, Yunnan), male: A . face; B–C . head and pronotum: B . dorsal view; C . lateral view; D–G . apex of abdomen: D , F . lateral view; E . apical view; G . ventral view; H . stridulatory pegs on second and third abdominal tergites; female: I . subgenital plate; J . ovipositor in lateral view.

FIGURE 3.
Homogryllacris yunnana Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
(specimens from Jinping, Yunnan), male: A . face; B–C . head and pronotum: B . lateral view; C . dorsal view; D–H . apex of abdomen: D , F . lateral view; E . apical view; G . dorsal view; H . ventral view; female: I . seventh abdominal sternite and subgenital plate; J . ovipositor in lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. China ( Yunnan ).

Discussion. When examining the
Homogryllacris
specimens collected from Yunnan , we discovered four specimens sampled from Jinping, Yunnan are very similar to
Homogryllacris yunnana Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
with regard to the posterior processes on male tenth abdominal tergite, but they differ from the latter in the following: posterior processes of male tenth abdominal tergite distinctly shorter, basal halves cylindrical, apical halves compressed, sickle-shaped, not decussate, apical areas slightly incurved, tips subacute. Furthermore, DNA sequencing was implemented in two of these four specimens sampled from Jinping, Yunnan and two specimens of
Homogryllacris yunnana Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
sampled from Meizihu, Pu’er, Yunnan based on COI gene, respectively, the genetic distance between them is about 4.1%, which is far below the minimum value of interspecific genetic distances (The interspecific genetic distances range are 6.59–19.49% in the genus according to our analysis). As a consequence, with the consideration of morphological and molecular evidence, we regard these four specimens sampled from Jinping, Yunnan as a geographical population of
Homogryllacris yunnana Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
and the morphological difference mentioned above belongs to intraspecific variation.

Homogryllacris platycis Liu & Bian, 2021
. In : Liu, Yang & Bian, Zootaxa , 5067 (2): 287.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Holotype : male; type locality: Gulinqing , Maguan , Yunnan .

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. China ( Yunnan ).

Discussion. This species was originally described by Liu et al . (2021) based on a male specimen ( holotype : male, type locality: Gulinqing, Maguan, Yunnan ) and two female specimens from the type locality. We examined specimens of the species from the type locality and one female was identified as this species based on the shape of seventh abdominal sternite and subgenital plate, but two male specimens are more similar to
Homogryllacris brevispina Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012
with respect to male abdominal apex and differ from original description of
Homogryllacris platycis
Liu & Bian, 2021
in the following: posterior processes on tenth abdominal tergite obviously longer, moderately incurved on the whole apart from basal areas, apical areas decussate and pointing outwards. Furthermore, according to results of molecular species delimitation in most species of
Homogryllacris
based on COI gene (unpublished), samples from Gulinqing, Maguan, Yunnan and Yaoshan, Hekou, Yunnan were assigned into a single molecular operational taxonomic unit (MOTU) in all five approaches. As a consequence, morphological difference of posterior processes on male tenth abdominal tergite is regarded as intraspecific variation.

Homogryllacris rufovaria Liu, 2007
, Scientific Research Monthly , 6 (7): 2; Liu, Bi & Zhang, 2010 . In : Xu, H.C. & Ye, T.X. (Eds.). Insects of Fengyangshan National Nature Reserve , 63; Shi, Guo & Bian, 2012 , Zootaxa , 3414: 60.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Holotype : male; type locality: Baishanzu , Qingyuan , Zhejiang .

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. China ( Hunan , Zhejiang , Fujian ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Homogryllacris platycis Liu & Bian, 2021
(specimens from Yaoshan, Hekou, Yunnan), male: A . face; B–C . head and pronotum: B . lateral view; C . dorsal view; D–G . apex of abdomen: D , E . apical view; F , G . lateral view; H . subgenital plate; female: I . seventh abdominal sternite and subgenital plate; J . ovipositor in lateral view.

FIGURE 5.
Homogryllacris platycis Liu & Bian, 2021
(specimens from the type locality), male: A . face; B–C . head and pronotum: B . lateral view; C . dorsal view; D–H . apex of abdomen: D , E . apical view; F , G . lateral view; H . ventral view; female: I . seventh abdominal sternite and subgenital plate; J . ovipositor in lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
5.
Homogryllacris nigromacula
sp. nov. ,
Chinese name AEǓ同Oiǿ

Description. Body small-sized for the genus. Head: Face narrow ovoid; fastigium verticis wider than antennal scape. Eyes ovoid, slightly protruding forwards; ocelli distinct, oval. Pronotum short and broad, anterior margin slightly protruding forward, posterior margin straight. Lateral areas of second and third abdominal tergites each with two rows of stridulatory pegs.
Wings: squamous, tegmina almost equal to the length of pronotum, nearly reaching posterior margin of first abdominal tergite, with 7 subparallel longitudinal veins; hind wings absent.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6.
Homogryllacris nigromacula
sp. nov.
, male: A . face; B–C . head and pronotum: B . lateral view; C . dorsal view; D–H . apex of abdomen: D . lateral view; E , F . apical view; G . dorsal view; H . ventral view; female: I . seventh abdominal sternite and subgenital plate in ventral view; J . ovipositor in lateral view.

FIGURE 7. Habitus of
Homogryllacris nigromacula
sp. nov. A
. male; B . female.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs: Fore coxa with 1 spine. Fore and middle femora unarmed on ventral surfaces; fore and middle tibiae with 4 pairs of long spines and 1 pair of short apical spurs on ventral surfaces respectively. Hind femur with 11–12 inner spines and 3–5 outer spines on ventral surface; hind tibia with 6–7 inner spines and 6 outer spines on dorsal surface, bearing 1 pair of dorsal apical spurs and 2 pairs of ventral apical spurs, ventral surface with 1 pair of rather short pre-apical spurs.

Coloration. Body light brown. Fastigium verticis with dark brown spots; occiput with a large irregular dark brown spot. Inner margin of antennal socket black, base and apex of antennal scape, base of pedicel with dark brown spots, other area of antenna brown. Eyes black. Ocelli light yellow. Face with a longitudinal dark brown stripe in the midline, genae under eyes with a thin black stripe separately, behind eyes each with a dark brown spot. Pronotum with black stripe along entire margin; disc with a broad longitudinal light red stripe; anterior area of disc with a pair of irregular dark brown spots; lateral lobe of pronotum with a broad and irregular dark brown stripe separately. Tegmen semi-transparent with dark brown veins. Metanotum and dorsal surface of abdomen black. Fore femur and tibia light red as well as middle femur and tibia.Apical half of hind femur and hind tibia light red. Posterior processes on male tenth abdominal tergite black. Apical areas of spines and spurs on hind femur and tibia dark brown.

Male. Ninth abdominal tergite broad at base, gradually narrowing, posterior margin rounded. Tenth abdominal tergite very short, the middle of posterior margin with a pair of robust and short posterior processes, basal halves strongly swollen, apical halves spiniform and crossing each other, pointing ventrad and forwards, tips subacute. Cerci conical and long, apices rounded. Subgenital plate with lateral margins subparallel, posterior margin with a V-shaped incision, lateral lobes with apices rounded. Styli cylindrical with apices rounded, inserted on apical lateral margins of lateral lobes of subgenital plate.

Female. Appearance is similar to that of male. Seventh abdominal sternite wider than long. Subgenital plate trapezoidal, basal area broad, membranous with transverse folds, posterior margin slightly concave. Ovipositor rather long, much longer than hind femur, almost straight, dorsal and ventral margins subparallel, apex rounded.

Material examined.
Holotype : ♂ , Chomo, Xigazê, Xizang , 9 September, 2023, coll. Tao Zhang.
Paratype : 1♀ , same data as holotype
.
Other specimens : 2♂ 2♀ , same data as holotype
.
Distribution. China ( Xizang ).
Etymology. The name of the new species derives from pronotum with dark brown spots, from Latin nigr - (dark) and macul - (spots).

Discussion. The new species is very similar to
Homogryllacris rufovaria Liu, 2007
with regard to the shape of posterior processes on male tenth abdominal tergite, but it differs from the latter in the following characters: tegmen distinctly short, almost equal to the length of pronotum, reaching posterior margin of first abdominal tergite, hind wing absent; posterior processes on male tenth abdominal tergite obviously longer; face, occiput and pronotum with dark brown spots or stripes, metanotum and dorsal surface of abdomen black.

subSection.paragraph: This project is supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (No. 31872268, 32270488).
